definition: to harness/to draw (a cart etc)/to drive/to pilot/to sail/to ride/your good self/prefixed word denoting respect (polite 敬辞)
to collapse/to fall into ruins/death of king or emperor/demise

sentences.english: The emperor died suddenly, LiZhi, know that panic.
sentences.chinese: 皇上突然驾崩，李治等人知道后十分惊慌。

sentences.english: All the flags were at half-mast when the king died.
sentences.chinese: 国王驾崩，全国都下半旗志哀。

sentences.english: China's first emperor Qin Shihuang died in 209 BC.
sentences.chinese: 公元前209年，中国第一位皇帝秦始皇驾崩。

sentences.english: The death of that emperor marked the end of a golden era.
sentences.chinese: 那位皇帝的驾崩代表着一段黄金时期的结束。

sentences.english: Ever since the big throne from sun in sky passes away, big Yan ugg boots red month then have been lining up infantry every front.
sentences.chinese: 自从天阳大帝驾崩，大燕和红月便一直陈兵各条战线。

definition: to succeed to a title/to inherit
to confer a title on (an empress or a prince)
Taishang Huang/Retired Emperor/father of the reigning emperor/fig. puppet master
